articles.author: ZEKE MILLER, MICHELLE L. PRICE, WILL WEISSERT and JILL COLVIN
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Donald Trump was elected the 47th president of the United States on Wednesday, an extraordinary comeback for a former president who refused to accept defeat four years ago, sparked a violent insurrection at the U.S.
articles.title: Trump wins the White House in political comeback rooted in appeals to frustrated voters

articles.author: STEVE PEOPLES and BILL BARROW
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Donald Trump scored a decisive victory in a deeply divided nation. And in so doing, the Republican president-elect exposed a fundamental weakness within the Democratic base and beat back concerns about his moral failings, becoming the first U.S.
articles.title: Election takeaways: Trump's decisive victory in a deeply divided nation

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.description: Republican Donald Trump was elected the 47th president of the United States on Wednesday, an extraordinary comeback for a former president who refused to accept defeat four years ago, sparked a violent insurrection at the U.S.
articles.title: The Latest: Donald Trump wins US presidency, GOP reclaims Senate majority

articles.author: LISA MASCARO and MARY CLARE JALONICK
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Republicans have taken control of the U.S. Senate and are fighting to keep their majority in the U.S.
articles.title: Republicans take Senate majority and eye unified power with Trump

articles.author: CHRISTINA A. CASSIDY and ALI SWENSON
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — A series of bomb threats across multiple battleground states and baseless claims of wrongdoing by former President Donald Trump disrupted an otherwise smooth Election Day that capped a tumultuous presidential campaign.
articles.title: Bomb threats in swing states disrupt a mostly smooth Election Day

articles.author: GEOFF MULVIHILL and CHRISTINE FERNANDO
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Voters in Missouri cleared the way to undo one of the nation's most restrictive abortion bans in one of five victories for abortion rights advocates, while Florida, Nebraska and South Dakota defeated similar constitutional amendments, leaving bans in place.
articles.title: Abortion rights advocates win in 6 states and clear way to overturn Missouri ban but lose in 3

articles.author: DAVID A. LIEB
articles.description: A costly campaign to legalize recreational marijuana in Florida failed Tuesday and California voters took a step toward tough crime laws as voters in dozens of states weighed more than 140 measures appearing on the ballot alongside races for president and top state offices.
articles.title: Marijuana legalization fails in Florida as numerous states approve citizen voting amendments

articles.author: JOSH BOAK and LINLEY SANDERS
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Voters for Kamala Harris and Donald Trump who cast their ballots for Tuesday’s presidential election had vastly different motivations — reflecting a broader national divide on the problems the United States faces.
articles.title: AP VoteCast: Harris voters motivated by democracy, Trump supporters by inflation and immigration

articles.author: ZIMO ZHONG and ELAINE KURTENBACH
articles.description: HONG KONG (AP) — Share prices, bond yields and bitcoin surged Wednesday as the Republican party gained control of the Senate and former President Donald Trump closed in on the 270 electoral votes needed to return him to the White House.
articles.title: Stocks, bond yields and bitcoin surge as Trump closes in on US election victory

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.description: Lebanon’s Civil Defense service says they have pulled 30 bodies from the rubble of an apartment building that Israel struck the night before. Search efforts were ongoing Wednesday, and it was unclear how many survivors or bodies were still trapped under the rubble.
articles.title: Middle East latest: Rescue workers pull 30 bodies from apartments in Lebanon after Israeli strike
